info.description: Fetch reports with performance metrics for DSP campaigns.
info.title: DSP Reports

requestBody.description: Create report request body. Version of request can be specified in the accept.

post.description:
Use this operation to request creation of a report that includes metrics about your Amazon DSP campaigns. Specify the `type` of report and the `metrics` you'd like to include. Note that the value specified for the `dimensions` field affects the metrics included in the report. See the `dimensions` field description for more information.

**Authorized resource type**:
DSP Rodeo Entity ID, DSP Advertiser Account ID

**Parameter name**:
accountId

**Parameter in**:
path

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["view_performance_dashboard"]

200.description: Successful operation. Version can be specified in the accept. By default returns latest version

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. See [create API authorization and refresh tokens](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/setting-up/generate-api-tokens) for more information.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account Identifier you use to access the DSP. This is your DSP Entity ID if you have access to all DSP advertisers within that entity, or your DSP Advertiser ID if you only have access to a specific advertiser ID.

get.summary: Gets the metadata of a report previously requested.
get.description:
Pass the identifier of a previously requested report in the `reportId` field to get the current status of the report. While the report is pending, `status` is set to `IN_PROGRESS`. When a response with `status` set to `SUCCESS` is returned, the report is available for download at the address specified in the `location` field.

**Authorized resource type**:
DSP Rodeo Entity ID, DSP Advertiser Account ID

**Parameter name**:
accountId

**Parameter in**:
path

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["view_performance_dashboard"]

200.description: Successful operation. Version can be specified in the accept. By default returns latest version

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The client identifier. See [create API authorization and refresh tokens](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/setting-up/generate-api-tokens) for more information.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Account Identifier for DSP. Please input DSP entity ID if you want to retrieve reports
for a group of advertisers, or input DSP advertiser ID if you want to retrieve reports for a single advertiser.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The identifier of the requested report.

requestId.description: A unique identifier of the request.

message.description: A human-readable description of the response.

errors.description: A list of errors. Please check the values in this field for report validation errors.

advertiserIds.description: List of advertisers specified by identifier to include in the report. If this field is not specified, the report includes data for all advertisers included in the scope specified in the `Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope` header. Note that if an advertiser identifier is specified that is not available under the scope provided in the header, the response is `422 - Unprocessable Entity`.

endDate.description: Date in YYYYMMDD format. The report contains only metrics generated on the specified date range between startDate and endDate. The maximum date range between startDate and endDate is 31 days. The endDate can be up to 90 days older from today.

orderIds.description: List of orders specified by identifier to include in the report. If this field is not specified, the report includes data for all orders included in the scope specified in the `Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope` header. Note that if an order identifier is specified that is not available under the scope provided in the header, the response is `422 - Unprocessable Entity`.

metrics.description: Specify a comma-delimited string of metrics field names to include in the report. For example: "impressions, clickThroughs, CTR, eCPC, totalCost, eCPM". If no metric field names are specified, only the default fields and selected `DIMENSION` fields are included by default. Specifying default fields returns an error.<details><summary>`Common Fields`</summary><summary>These fields will be added when reportType is `CAMPAIGN, INVENTORY, or startDate.description: Date in YYYYMMDD format. The report contains only metrics generated on the specified date range between startDate and endDate. The maximum date range between startDate and endDate is 31 days. The startDate can be up to 90 days older from today.

dimensions.description:
List of dimensions to include in the report. Specify one or many comma-delimited strings of dimensions. For example: ["ORDER", "LINE_ITEM", "CREATIVE"]. Adding a dimension in this array determines the aggregation level of the report data and also adds the fields for that dimension in the report. If the list is null or empty, the aggregation of the report data is at `ORDER` level. The allowed values can be used together in this array as an allowed value in which case the report aggregation will be at the lowest aggregation level and the report will contain the fields for all the dimensions included in the report.<details><summary>`Default Fields`</summary></br>date (for timeUnit `DAILY`)</br>intervalStart (for timeUnit `SUMMARY`)</br>intervalEnd (for timeUnit `SUMMARY`)</br>segment (Only present for AUDIENCE Report)</br>entityId</br>advertiserName</br>advertiserId</details></br><summary>The below fields will be added based on selected dimensions  </summary></br><details><summary>`ORDER`</summary></br>orderName</br>orderId</br>orderStartDate</br>orderEndDate</br>orderBudget</br>orderExternalId</br>orderCurrency</details></br><details><summary>`LINE_ITEM`</summary></br>lineItemName</br>lineItemId</br>lineItemStartDate</br>lineItemEndDate</br>lineItemBudget</br>lineItemExternalId</details></br><details><summary>`CREATIVE`</summary></br>creativeName</br>creativeID</br>creativeType</br>creativeSize</br>creativeAdId</details></br><details><summary>`SITE`</summary></br>siteName</details></br><details><summary>`SUPPLY`</summary></br>supplySourceName</details></br><details><summary>`DEAL`</summary></br>deal</br>dealID</details></br><details><summary>`COUNTRY`</summary></br>country</details></br><details><summary>`STATE_COUNTY_REGION`</summary></br>region</details></br><details><summary>`CITY`</summary></br>city</details></br><details><summary>`DMA`</summary></br>designatedMarketAreaCode</br>designatedMarketAreaName</details></br><details><summary>`POSTAL_CODE`</summary></br>postalCode</details></br><details><summary>`OPERATING_SYSTEM`</summary></br>operatingSystem</details></br><details><summary>`BROWSER_TYPE`</summary></br>browser</details></br><details><summary>`BROWSER_VERSION`</summary></br>browserVersion</details></br><details><summary>`DEVICE_TYPE`</summary></br>device</details></br><details><summary>`ENVIRONMENT_TYPE`</summary></br>environmentType</details>

| Type | Dimension |
|------|-----------|
| CAMPAIGN | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, CREATIVE |
| INVENTORY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, SITE, SUPPLY, DEAL |
| AUDIENCE | ORDER, LINE_ITEM |
| PRODUCTS | ORDER, LINE_ITEM |
| TECHNOLOGY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, OPERATING_SYSTEM, BROWSER_TYPE, BROWSER_VERSION, DEVICE_TYPE, ENVIRONMENT_TYPE |
| GEOGRAPHY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, COUNTRY, STATE_COUNTY_REGION, CITY, DMA, POSTAL_CODE |

timeUnit.description: Adding timeUnit determines the aggregation level (`SUMMARY` or `DAILY`) of the report data. If the timeUnit is null or empty, the aggregation of the report data is at the `SUMMARY` level and aggregated at the time period specified. `DAILY` timeUnit is not supported for `AUDIENCE` report type. The report will contain the fields based on timeUnit:<details><summary>`SUMMARY`</summary>intervalStart</br>intervalEnd</details></br><details><summary>`DAILY`</summary>Date</details>

format.description: The data format of the report.

statusDetails.description: A human-readable description of the current status.

location.description: The URI address of the report.

expiration.description: The expiration time of the URI in the location property in milliseconds. The expiration time is the interval between the time the response was generated and the time the URI expires.

status.description: The build status of the report.

advertiserIds.description: List of advertisers specified by identifier to include in the report. This should not be present if accountId is advertiser

endDate.description: Date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The report contains only metrics generated on the specified date range between startDate and endDate. The maximum date range between startDate and endDate is 31 days. The endDate can be up to 90 days older from today.

orderIds.description: List of orders specified by identifier to include in the report.

metrics.description: Specify a list of metrics field names to include in the report. For example: ["impressions", "clickThroughs", "CTR", "eCPC", "totalCost", "eCPM"]. If no metric field names are specified, only the default fields and selected `DIMENSION` fields are included by default. Specifying default fields returns an error.<details><summary>`Common Fields`</summary><summary>These fields will be added when reportType is `CAMPAIGN, INVENTORY, or startDate.description: Date in yyyy-MM-dd format. The report contains only metrics generated on the specified date range between startDate and endDate. The maximum date range between startDate and endDate is 31 days. The startDate can be up to 90 days older from today.

dimensions.description:
List of dimensions to include in the report. Specify one or many comma-delimited strings of dimensions. For example: ["ORDER", "LINE_ITEM", "CREATIVE"]. Adding a dimension in this array determines the aggregation level of the report data and also adds the fields for that dimension in the report. If the list is null or empty, the aggregation of the report data is at `ORDER` level. The allowed values can be used together in this array as an allowed value in which case the report aggregation will be at the lowest aggregation level and the report will contain the fields for all the dimensions included in the report.<details><summary>`Default Fields`</summary></br>date (for timeUnit `DAILY`)</br>intervalStart (for timeUnit `SUMMARY`)</br>intervalEnd (for timeUnit `SUMMARY`)</br>segment (Only present for AUDIENCE Report)</br>entityId</br>advertiserName</br>advertiserId</details></br><summary>The below fields will be added based on selected dimensions  </summary></br><details><summary>`ORDER`</summary></br>orderName</br>orderId</br>orderStartDate</br>orderEndDate</br>orderBudget</br>orderExternalId</br>orderCurrency</details></br><details><summary>`LINE_ITEM`</summary></br>lineItemName</br>lineItemId</br>lineItemStartDate</br>lineItemEndDate</br>lineItemBudget</br>lineItemExternalId</details></br><details><summary>`CREATIVE`</summary></br>creativeName</br>creativeID</br>creativeType</br>creativeSize</br>creativeAdId - Note, this field is not returned for the CONVERSION_SOURCE report type.</details></br><details><summary>`SITE`</summary></br>siteName</details></br><details><summary>`SUPPLY`</summary></br>supplySourceName</details></br><details><summary>`DEAL`</summary></br>deal</br>dealID</details></br><details><summary>`COUNTRY`</summary></br>country</details></br><details><summary>`STATE_COUNTY_REGION`</summary></br>region</details></br><details><summary>`CITY`</summary></br>city</details></br><details><summary>`DMA`</summary></br>designatedMarketAreaCode</br>designatedMarketAreaName</details></br><details><summary>`POSTAL_CODE`</summary></br>postalCode</details></br><details><summary>`OPERATING_SYSTEM`</summary></br>operatingSystem</details></br><details><summary>`BROWSER_TYPE`</summary></br>browser</details></br><details><summary>`BROWSER_VERSION`</summary></br>browserVersion</details></br><details><summary>`DEVICE_TYPE`</summary></br>device</details></br><details><summary>`ENVIRONMENT_TYPE`</summary></br>environmentType</details></br><details><summary>`CONVERSION_SOURCE`</summary></br>conversionSourceName</br>conversionSourceOwner</br>conversionSourceAttributionType</br>conversionSourceScaled</br>maxExpectedLatencyHours</details>

| Type | Dimension |
|------|-----------|
| CAMPAIGN | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, CREATIVE |
| INVENTORY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, SITE, SUPPLY, DEAL |
| AUDIENCE | ORDER, LINE_ITEM |
| PRODUCTS | ORDER, LINE_ITEM |
| TECHNOLOGY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, OPERATING_SYSTEM, BROWSER_TYPE, BROWSER_VERSION, DEVICE_TYPE, ENVIRONMENT_TYPE |
| GEOGRAPHY | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, COUNTRY, STATE_COUNTY_REGION, CITY, DMA, POSTAL_CODE | 
 CONVERSION_SOURCE | ORDER, LINE_ITEM, CREATIVE

timeUnit.description: Adding timeUnit determines the aggregation level (`SUMMARY` or `DAILY`) of the report data. If the timeUnit is null or empty, the aggregation of the report data is at the `SUMMARY` level and aggregated at the time period specified. `DAILY` timeUnit is not supported for `AUDIENCE` report type. The report will contain the fields based on timeUnit:<details><summary>`SUMMARY`</summary>intervalStart</br>intervalEnd</details></br><details><summary>`DAILY`</summary>Date</details>

field.description: Request body field which is cause of the error.

format.description: The data format of the report.

statusDetails.description: A human-readable description of the current status.

location.description: The URI address of the report.

expiration.description: The expiration time of the URI in the location property in date-time format(yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss). The expiration time is the time when the download link expires.

status.description: The build status of the report.

DSPReportsEndpointRequestTimedOut.description: Endpoint Request Timed-out Exception. This can be due to intermittent issue and can be retried

DSPReportsTooManyRequests.description: Too Many Requests - Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

DSPReportsUnauthorized.description: Unauthorized - Request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

DSPReportsUnprocessableEntity.description: Unprocessable entity - Failed due to invalid parameters.

DSPReportsNotFound.description: Not Found - Requested resource does not exist or is not visible for the authenticated user.

DSPReportsForbidden.description: Forbidden - Request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

DSPReportsInternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved..
